ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Staff code number of person completing this form
1.What year is it now?(Unweighted score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 1(Max error=1)

ElementDescription: 1.What year is it now?(Weighted score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 1 multiplied by 4

ElementDescription: 2.What month is it now?(Unweighted score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 2(Max error=1)

ElementDescription: 2.What month is it now?(Weighted score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 2 multiplied by 3

ElementDescription: 3.About what time is it? (within 1 hour)(Unweighted Score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 3(Max error=1)

ElementDescription: 3.About what time is it? (within 1 hour)(Weighted Score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 3 multiplied by 3

ElementDescription: 4.Count backwards 20 to 1(Unweighted score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 4(Max error=2)

ElementDescription: 4.Count backwards 20 to 1(Weighted score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 4 multiplied by 2

ElementDescription: 5.Say the months in reverse order(Unweighted Score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 5(Max error=2)

ElementDescription: 5.Say the months in reverse order(Weighted Score)
Notes: Number of errors in response to question 5 multiplied by 2

ElementDescription: Repeat the memory phrase(John Brown, 42 Market Street, Chicago or John Brown,42 West Street, Gateshead)(Unweighted)
Notes: Number of errors repeating the memory phrase(Max error=5)

ElementDescription: Repeat the memory phrase(John Brown, 42 Market Street, Chicago or John Brown,42 West Street, Gateshead)(Weighted)
Notes: Number of errors repeating the memory phrase multiplied by 2

ElementDescription: Unweighted Error Score
Weighted Error Score
Notes: This gives a 0-28 score with a higher being better; scores over 20 being ‘normal’
